questions.clue: This file demonstrates the format of a Jeopardy! game file.
Don't know the date the clue was first seen, or making up your own? Then leave this field out.
This field is case insensitive and can be a single string or an array of strings.
I'm not creative to keep up the formatting. Anyway, having multiple responses is recommended
responses: Even with only one canonical answer
there can be multiple accecptable responses
or including different parts of a name
(alongside some clues having multiple correct answers on the calendar)

questions.clue: While intended for specifically for the Jeopardy! calendar, this format can theoritically be used for any game
questions.responses: Edit the schema in `/.vscode/settings.json` to fit your needs (or just delete it if you don't care about validation)

questions.clue: The day before final, the final category will also be revealed
questions.responses: and players will be able to wager

questions.clue: For final, the dollor value should be set to `null`
questions.responses: (it should be optional for final, but I haven't figured out how to set that in the schema yet)
